case_vignette: a 70-year-old female with past medical history of end stage renal disease on hemodialysis, coronary artery disease presents to dermatology clinic complaining of a painful rash on the right leg present for several weeks and enlargening. she admits she often misses hemodialysis sessions. examination of the right lower leg demonstrates a retiform violaceous plaque with large black eschar. a punch biopsy reveals calcification of small and medium sized vessels with thrombosis.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painful rash on my right leg that has been getting bigger for several weeks.
Can you describe the appearance of the rash?
The rash on my leg is a purple patch with a large black scab.
Do you have any other health conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
Yes, I have end-stage renal disease and coronary artery disease, and I am on hemodialysis.
Have you previously had any similar rashes or skin issues, or is this the first occurrence?
This is the first occurrence of this type of rash.
Has there been any injury or trauma to the area where the rash appeared?
No, there hasn't been any injury or trauma to the area.
Do you have any known allergies, particularly to medications or environmental factors?
No, I don't have any known allergies.
Final Diagnosis: Calciphylaxis
